body_html: @apaszke Actually, this seems like a simpler JIT problem: previously we assumed that the CPU implementation was always unfused in the JIT test, and this simply makes it not so. So we should probably just rewrite the JIT test to not go through the normal codepath (or use one of those symbolic wrappers) and call it a day.

body: @apaszke Actually, this seems like a simpler JIT problem: previously we assumed that the CPU implementation was always unfused in the JIT test, and this simply makes it not so. So we should probably just rewrite the JIT test to not go through the normal codepath (or use one of those symbolic wrappers) and call it a day.
